summary: This bill, the Department of the Interior, Environment, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2026, allocates funds for various federal agencies including the Department of the Interior, Environmental Protection Agency, Forest Service, and Indian Health Service. It covers areas like land management, environmental programs, scientific research, and infrastructure. Several provisions address wildland fire management, the Land and Water Conservation Fund, and impose restrictions related to lead ammunition, endangered species, and other environmental regulations. It also includes funding for tribal programs, insular affairs, and several general provisions concerning transparency and specific agency actions.
